DataElement.preferredName: Concordance Local Pathology Review Data Entry Performed By Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the person that inspected and verified the local institution's source data reported in the local pathology review form.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Concordance Local Pathology Review Data Entry Performed By
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An agreement of findings._Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria._The process by which original, source data is inputed by a human into a digital, structured format for later use and analysis._Indicates the person, group, or institution who carried out the action.

Property.preferredName: Local Pathology Review Data Entry Performed By
Property.preferredDefinition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.:The process by which original, source data is inputed by a human into a digital, structured format for later use and analysis.:Indicates the person, group, or institution who carried out the action.

Concepts.definition: Microscopic examination of tissue specimen(s) by a pathologist in the local institution where a patient had a procedure performed, using local standardized methods and criteria.
The process by which original, source data is inputed by a human into a digital, structured format for later use and analysis.
Indicates the person, group, or institution who carried out the action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/13/20 jk RS chg to Qualified.  1/23/20 jk released per CPTAC SME's review of PRAD Path Review CDE set. 1/6/20 jk created for CPTAC Local Path CRFs; applicable to all tumor types.
